scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the whole gang is there, the guys are
watching football, the girls are cooking Thanksgiving dinner.]

dialogue.speaker: THE GUYS
dialogue.text: (reacting to a play) Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Awww!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey, it’s your Thanksgiving too, y'know, instead of watching football, you could help.

dialogue.speaker: THE GUYS
dialogue.text: We will. (they don’t move)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, Rachel, you wanna put the marshmellows in concentric circles.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No Mon, you want to put them in concentric circles. I want to do this.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Every year.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Y'know, for once, I am going to sit down and try to watch one of these things. (just as she sits down).

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Halftime.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, who wants to ah, throw the ball around a little, maybe get a little three on three going?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh! That would be sooo much fun!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, can I play too? I’ve never played football, like ever.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Great, you can cover Chandler.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, no, no, I don’t, I don’t really wanna play.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on man! You never want to do anything since you and Janice broke up.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That’s not true! I wanted to wear my bathrobe and eat peanut clusters all day. I wanted to start drinking in the morning. Don’t say that I don’t have goals!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Chandler, you have to start getting over her. All right, if you play, you get some fresh air, maybe it’ll take your mind off Janice, and if you don’t play, everyone will be mad at you ‘cause the teams won’t be even. Come on.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, all right, I’ll play.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yay!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Let’s do it! Ross?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Do you wanna play football?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Um, Monica and I aren’t supposed to play football.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Says who? Your mom?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA AND ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, every, every Thanksgiving um, we used to have a touch football game called the ‘Geller Bowl.’

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, no, no, you say that proudly.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Anyway, Ross and I were always captains, and um, it got kind’ve competitive and one year, Geller Bowl VI, I accidentally broke Ross’s nose.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It was soo not an accident. She saw I was about to tag her, so she threw her big fat grandma arm elbow right into my face. And just keep running.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: To score the winning touchdown, by the way.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, ho, ho, ho, you did not win the game, the touchdown didn’t count, because of the spectacularly illegal, oh and by the way savage nose breaking.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Chandler and Joey) I won the game.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh yeah! Then how come you didn’t get the Geller Cup?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Um, there was a Geller Cup?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, it was the trophy you got if you won the game. But our Dad said, ‘nobody won that game, ‘ and he was sick of our fighting, so he took the trophy and.... (pauses to collect himself, as he is on the verge of tears saying this) threw it in the lake.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And was the curse lifted?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Anyway. That’s when our Mom said we were not to play football ever again.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'know what, I think we should play a game. I mean come on, it’s been twelve years.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Can I see you for a second?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (shouting) Once!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: All right, we’re gonna play.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: But wait a minute though, how are we gonna get there, though, because my Mom won’t let me cross the street.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Park, the gang is warming up for their football game.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay. Let’s bring it in.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wait no, honey, honey throw it to me, throw it to me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Here you go. (throws her the ball)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (knocking it down instead of catching it) That almost hit me in the face.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, we have to pick captains.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And then Tineals.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, so how do we decide that?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, why don’t we just bunny up.

dialogue.speaker: AND JOEY
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA AND ROSS
dialogue.text: (holding both of their hands above their heads making rabbit ears with their fingers.) Bunny!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, looks like Ross and I are captains. Okay, so um, I bunnied first so that means I get to pick first. Joey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Monica, I’m your best friend.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Sweetie, don’t worry you’ll get picked. Chandler.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Phoebe.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Sweetie, now I pick you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You don’t pick me! You’re stuck with me!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay. All right. So let’s see, let’s play from the trash can, to the lightpost. Right. Two hand touch, we’ll kick off.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right people listen, I’ve got exactly twenty-eight minutes before I have to baste again.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Wow! Just like in the pros.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Huddle up.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to his team) All right, huddle up, right over here.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wait for me! Wait for me! Wait for me! Oh cool, this is my first huddle.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, so what do you guys really think of Chandler?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, Phoebe you know what you’re doing right?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, Joey’s gonna catch it, and you and I are gonna block.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What’s block?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Phoebe, I thought you said you know what you’re doing?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I thought you meant in life.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Break.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: The ball is Janice. The ball is Janice. (goes to kick the ball but kicks Ross’s foot instead.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oww!! Son of a...!! Ow! Come on!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Sorry. I’m sorry. Y'know what, we’re just gonna throw it.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I got it. (catches the ball)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Go! Go! Go!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Score!! 7 to nothing!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (coming over to Ross, who is just getting up) Are you okay?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come on, let’s go!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Losers walk!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, losers talk!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, no, no, actually losers rhyme.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (coming up under center, just like a real quarterback does, and puts his hands between Ross’s legs.) Twenty-three!! Seventy-four!! (Ross stands up and looks at him) You wanna go shotgun?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (from the shotgun) Hike!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA AND JOEY
dialogue.text: One-Mississippi. Two-Mississippi. Three-Mississippi.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Over here!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (proud of her self) I almost caught that one!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Great! Now, the score is 7 to almost 7.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, (to Chandler) this play, I want you to do a down and out to the right. Okay. Break!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wait, what am I gonna do?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You, you go long.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wait, how long?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Until we start to look very small.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Break!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Set....hike!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: One-Mississippi, two-Mississippi, switch! Switch! Switch!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, no, no, no, no!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Haaaaa! Hey-hey, thanks for stopping our ball.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: (in a foreign accent) You are playing American football?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah! Wow, your like from a whole other country.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: I’m Dutch.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hi-hi, I’m Joey.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: I’m Margha.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I’m sorry Dutch, I didn’t get that last little bit.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (running up) Hey Joey, do you wanna play football or you wanna.. (sees Marhan) Hi, I’m Chandler.

dialogue.speaker: MARGHA
dialogue.text: Hello, Chandler.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Her name is Dutch, and also Marklan.

dialogue.speaker: MARGHA
dialogue.text: Margha.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Mar-klan.

dialogue.speaker: MARGHA
dialogue.text: Mar-gha.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Mar-haaaan.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Come on guys! Let’s go! Come on, it’s second down.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh, hello, it’s third down.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No it’s not, it’s second.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wow!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow, what?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It just amazes me that your still pulling stuff like this.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Pulling what? It’s second down.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, it’s second down. (turns away) Take all the second downs you need.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I heard that!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, I said it loud.

dialogue.speaker: MARGHA
dialogue.text: It is okay, if I stay and watch?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER AND JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah! Why don’t you stick around. You can sit right there.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, that went well.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I think so.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know, I was thinking about ah, asking her for her number.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Thanks man, but I think it makes a stronger statement if I ask for it myself, y'know.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Whoa-ho, whoa! No, I was thinking about y'know for me, as a part of that whole getting over Janice thing you were talking about.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, that. All right, means that much to ya, I’ll let you have her.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Thanks. What, let me have her?! What do mean? Like if you didn’t I wouldn’t have a shot?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well I don’t like to say it out loud, but, yeah! Don’t feel bad man, we all have our strengths. You’re better with numbers and stuff.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Math!! You’re giving me math! All right, look y'know what, forget about it, you go for the girl, we’ll see who gets her.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Chandler, I want you to run a post pattern to the left, okay. And sweetie..

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know, go long. Y'know, it’s like all I’m doing is running back and forth from the huddle.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well ah, you wanna just stay out there?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Can I see that for second.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay. Hut! Hike!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Fumble!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What the hell’s the matter with you?! This is my favourite jersey.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well now you have two. Hey, I am good at math.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, that’s it. Y'know I was still gonna let you have her. But now, forget about it. Prepare to feel very bad about yourself.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey! Well, I’ve been preparing for that my entire life! Or something about you that’s mean!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, come on guys, let’s go! Tie score, and we’re runnin’ out of time. Forty-two!! Thirty-eight!! Hike! (the timer sounds as Monica throws the ball to Phoebe.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh I got it!! (catches the ball) Oh! Ew! Broken boob! Ow!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Pheebs, run!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Run, Phoebe, run!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Touchdown!! Touchdown!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh, hello, the buzzer buzzed. It doesn’t count.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: After the snap!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Before the snap!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: After!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Before!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Now, does it really matter?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yes!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, okay, I made a touchdown. It was my first touchdown. So?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh Pheebs, that’s great. It doesn’t count.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Does so count!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Cheater, cheater, compulsive eater.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my God!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'know what, that’s fine, maybe you haven’t grown up, but I have.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh-ho, okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Dead leg!! (kicks him in the thigh.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ow! Ow! Okay, okay, fine, fine! All right, you wanna win by cheating, go ahead, all right. Phoebe the touchdown does count, you win.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Woo-yay!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No! Listen, I’m not gonna go through this with you again, okay. Just once I wanna beat when you can’t blame it on the broken nose, the buzzer, or the fact that you thought you were getting mono. Let’s just call this, tie score and it’s halftime.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, first of all, I don’t play with cheaters, and second of all, you know I had swollen glands!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'know what? I’ll think you’ll play.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh really! Why is that?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Because the winner gets this!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: The Geller Cup.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Is everybody else seeing a troll doll nailed to a two by four?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, good.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The park, the gang is returning to play the second half of the game.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, where in the hell did you get that?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: When Mom and Dad drove you to the hospital to get your nose fixed, I swam into the lake and fished it out.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That cup is mine!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No it’s not! You want it, you’re gonna have to win it!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right, so are we not having dinner at all?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Come on Phoebe, let’s go! Come on, it’s time to get serious, huddle up. Joey, keep your head in the game.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It’s hard, y'know, his huddle is closer to Dutch girl.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right look, if I take Chandler out of the running will you be able to focus?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, you just make sure that Chandler catches the ball, I’ll take care of the rest.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Break!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Here you go!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Chandler! Chandler!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Margha) Hi.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Whoa! Whoa!! Tackled by a girl! Bet ya don’t see that everyday, do ya?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! What’s with the tackling?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?! I just touched him and he went over.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, you wanna play rough, we can play rough.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I love this game!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, where’d you get that?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I went really long.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Forty-two to twenty-one! Like the turkey, Ross is done!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It’s no surprise that your winning, ‘cause you got to pick first, so you got the better team.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You’re so pathetic! Why can’t you just accept it, we’re winning because I’m better than you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, what a great argument, exhaling! All right, y'know what, I’ll prove it to you, okay. I’ll trade you Joey for Rachel, and I’ll still win the game.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?! The guys against the girls? See, that’s ridiculous Monica, because I’m only down by three touchdowns.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, then bring it on! Oh, unless of course your afraid you might lose to a bunch of girls.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Fine, fine, Rachel your with Monica, Joey you’re with me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I can not believe your trading me!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Come on Rach, come on. Let’s see what’s it like to be on a winning team for a change.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Are you gonna let me play?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right then.

dialogue.speaker: MARGHA
dialogue.text: (coming over) The game is over, we eat now?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No-no-no-no, the game’s not over, we’re just switching teams.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, Chandler finds me so intimdating that it’s better if we’re on the same team.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Right. Okay, let’s play. Let’s go.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No ah, hold on a second Joe, where do Dutch people come from?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ah well, the ah, Pennsylvania Dutch, come from Pennsylvania.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And the other ah, Dutch people, they come on from somewhere near the Netherlands, right?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Nice try. (to Margha) See the Netherlands is this make believe place where Peter Pan and Tinker Bell come from.

dialogue.speaker: MARGHA
dialogue.text: Oh, my.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Enough with geography for the insane, okay? Let’s play some ball, guys.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoa, whoa, no, no, I-I’m not playing with this guy, now.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Fine with me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, y'know what, let’s just cut to the chase here. Okay? Heidi, which of my boys do you like?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER AND JOEY
dialogue.text: What are you doing? What are you doing? What are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: MARGHA
dialogue.text: Which do I like?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, y'know for dating, general merriment, taking back to your windmill...

dialogue.speaker: MARGHA
dialogue.text: Well, if I had to chose right now, which by the way I find really weird, I would have to say, Chandler.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Wait a minute! Wait a minute! She obviously didn’t understand the question.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, you don’t you have Captain Hook explain it to her.

dialogue.speaker: MARGHA
dialogue.text: I’m sorry, Joey, that is my chose.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You hear that! That is her chose, mister I’ll let you have her! I win! You suck! I rule all! A mini-wave in celebration of me!! (does the wave.)

dialogue.speaker: MARGHA
dialogue.text: I’m now thinking I would like to change my answer to, no one.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Wh-what?

dialogue.speaker: MARGHA
dialogue.text: I now find you shallow and um, a dork. All right, bye.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Nice going. You just saved yourself a couple months of sex.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know what, it doesn’t matter, ‘cause she picked me. Me! From now on I get the dates and you have to stay home on Saturday nights watching Ready, Set, Cook!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Save the breakthroughs for therapy, okay. The clock is ticking. We have no time, and we are losing, we are losing to girls.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: We’re not gonna lose to girls.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey! It’s 42-21!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: This sucks, I was just up by that much!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Are we playing football or what? Come on you hairy-backed Marries.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We have to do this. We are playing for women everywhere. Okay, just think about every lousy date that you ever had, okay, every guy who kept on the TV while you’re making out...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my God! You dated someone with a glass eye too?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Come on, okay, come on this is for all womankind. Let’s kill ‘um!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah!!! Kill ‘um!!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right, no, well I want to kill them to, but their boys, y'know how are we gonna beat three boys?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, we still have a minute and a half to go, and we’re down by two points. Two points.... (she gets interrupted by the guys, who are doing a slow-motion high five.) Phoebe you do a button-hook again. Rachel, you go long.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No! Come on! Don’t make me go long. Use me. They never cover me.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Honey, there’s a reason.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: God, I’m not lame, okay. I can do something. I can throw, would you let me throw, come on this is my game too.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Come on Mon, let her throw the ball.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right Rachel, you sweep behind, I’ll pitch it to you, you throw it down field to Phoebe. All right. Break.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Thank you! Break!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Thirty-two! Seventy-one! Hike!

dialogue.speaker: THE GUYS
dialogue.text: One-Mississippi! Two-Mississippi! Three-Mississippi!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I’m so sorry! Are you okay?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No! I’m not okay!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I’m sorry, they were just all coming at me, and I didn’t know what to do.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (looking at the timer) Thirty seconds left on the timer!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, so we get to take that stupid troll thing home!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Come on! Come on! Hurry! We’re running out of time! Huddle up!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. Oooh! Oh, this is our last huddle, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, Phoebe get open. Rachel, go long.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (on the verge of tears) Okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Break!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (in triumph) I got a touchdown! We did it!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey-hey-hey Rachel, funny thing. Actually, the ah, end zone starts at that pole, so you’re five feet short, so we win!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wait-wait-wait-wait! So, explain something to me though, if, if nobody tagged Rachel, then isn’t the play still going.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Let go! Let go!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Let go! I’m a tiny little woman!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Guys! Guys! Come on! It’s Thanksgiving, it’s not important who wins or loses. The important thing is, (to Joey) the Dutch girl picked me! Me! Not you! Holland loves Chandler! Thank you, Amsterdam! Good night!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ow!!

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel, Phoebe, Chandler, and Joey are eating Thanksgiving
dinner.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: We should defiantly play football more often. Maybe there’s a like league we could join or something.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Isn’t there a national football league.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes. Yes, there is, they play on Sundays and Monday nights.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh shoot! I work Monday nights.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Umm, this stuffing is amazing. Do you think we should bring them some?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: When they’re hungry enough, they’ll come in.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The park, it’s dark outside and Monica and Ross are still fighting over
the ball.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Let go!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No! You let go!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: How come it’s always us left in the field holding the ball?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don’t know. I guess the other people just don’t care enough.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey! It’s starting to snow.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Gimme the this!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Let go!
